userreviews.userReview: I would have to recommend anyone reading this short ebook! But please don't just stop there, put it into practice!!!

Michael's process is simple enough that you'll actually do it. It's also painful in that good way that healing often is.This isn't self-help platitudes or pablum. It's about getting your spiritual, mental, and physical house in order and keeping it in order. Beyond the basics of getting the plan set up and reviewing it regularly, Michael also recommends a few other resources, including the very popular book Getting Things Done; so far, Getting Things Done seems to be a good companion, getting into the micro-level where this very macro book has left off.

Creating a Personal Life Plan by Michael Hyatt is a short eBook, but the content is incredibly important and will have a huge influence on how you live your life - especially if you actually take the time to do the steps the book outlines. I greatly recommend it, and best of all, you can get it for free if you sign up for Michael Hyatt's free newsletter on www.michaelhyatt.com

This is an excellent E-book for those needing to re-invent themselves. I am a firm believer, that in order to move forward - you need a plan. Michael Hyatt gives just the thing needed in order to help us accomplish our goals. His words and tips are practical and advantageous to your life. I will certainly use it in my life. I cannot wait to get started on my life plan!

Don't Read. Good book, but better to read the books and blog he is pulling from. Start with Covey's 7 habits, move to "Getting Things Done" and then read Hyatt's top blog articles on plans and productivity. The book does have some helpful pages on his quarterly review process that may be unique to the book.

In his free e-book Creating Your Personal Life Plan: A Step-by-Step Guide for Designing the Life You’ve Always Wanted, recently retired Thomas Nelson Publishers CEO Michael Hyatt writes that most people put more thought into a week long holiday than they do to charting a course for their lives. I think that’s probably because creating a life plan seems so overwhelming and contingent on factors outside of our control.The book is quite helpful on those counts. Hyatt lays out some exercises and steps for determining where you want to go in life and then how to break that down into doable goals. Although a lot of his ideas are similar to other goal setting or achievement literature, I think his approach is unique and the book contains good resources.{Read more of my reviews at A Spirited Mind.}

A quick read which I enjoyed because it reminded me to stay on task with my life plan. It had a lot of the same material found in the book: The 7 Habits of Highly Efective People, but there were a few new ideas I am anxious to try. I do recommend this e-book to everyone.

Simple, direct, practical advice for living like you mean it. This isn't advice about being more productive or doing more things, but about spending more of your time doing what matters most. I'm looking forward to more purposeful living with the help of this guide.
Great ebook - free! - if you sign up to receive newsletters from http://www.michaelhyatt.com. I highly recommend that you do!
This is a really good and clean organized set up to create a life plan. If you subscribe to Hyatt's listserv, it's free.
In planning all the things at your work, we unknowingly forget about our own life. This is the book you need to read if you just want to know how to plan your life step by step.
A short ebook that emphasizes how we must be proactive in our time management, otherwise other people will manage our time (and our lives) by their priorities, not by our own.
it is nice book teach us how creat our personal life plan to make our life be easy and to achieve our goals in this life
Took me a while to get to the end. Not because the content was difficult. It wasn't but I wanted to properly put things into practice. And I'm still trying to discipline myself to follow the steps.
Just what I was looking for. Hard to look for the perfect, exact self help book, and this was it!
Very short and essential read.It is almost 50 pages long and the rest of the pages is all about the sheet he is using for the Life Plan.

description: Note: This ebook is no longer available. Please check out Living Forward: A Proven Plan to Stop Drifting and Get the Life You Want. It is on this same topic but much more developed.You can live your life on purpose by creating your own personal life plan.Why do you need a life plan? Three reasons:- It will give you clarity about where your life is headed.- It will keep you in balance when things get crazy.- It will give you peace of mind, knowing you are are addressing those aspects of your life that matter most.Creating Your Personal Life Plan is not so much an e-book as it is a life planning experience. In the e-book, I will take you through:- A visualization exercise that will give you enormous clarity on what matters most.- A five-step program for identifying where you are NOW, and how to get from here to where you want to be.- A weekly and quarterly process for keeping your life on-plan and moving in the direction of your highest priorities.- Two planning templates, a Word document and a separate Excel document, that will make it easier for you to create your plan and keep it up-to-date.
title: Creating Your Personal Life Plan: A Step-by-Step Guide for Designing the Life You've Always Wanted
